properties.otherAdvice:
Mother's Day Classic fun run & walk is taking place at Parramatta Park from 7am. Parramatta Park will be closed from 5am to 12pm midday. No parking will be available within the park during this time.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as attenddees travel to and from the event.

Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

webLinks.linkText: Mother's Day Classic Fun Run & Walk 2024

properties.publicTransport: Route 504 and 506 will be diverting while road closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of participants will take part in 5km and 10km Mother's Day Classic fun run and walk events starting from 7am in The Domain. Participants will travel along sections of Macquarie St, College St then Art Gallery Rd and Mrs Macquarie's Rd to finish back in The Domain by approximately 11:30am.

ROAD CLOSURES

  • 5am to 12pm midday - Art Gallery Rd/Mrs Macquarie's Rd from Prince Albert Rd and Hospital Rd. Access to Hospital Rd is via Shakespeare Pl only in both directions.
  • 6am to 10am - Macquarie St between St James Rd and Hunter St, College St between Park St and Prince Albert Rd and sections of St James Rd, Prince Albert Rd, St Mary's Rd and Yurong Pkwy will be closed.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 5am to 10am on sections of Macquarie St, Hunter St, College St, Prince Albert Rd, St Mary's Rd and St James Rd. Clearways will also be in effect on sections of Prince Albert Rd and Hospital Rd from 5am to 12pm midday.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Mother's Day is traditionally one of the busiest days on the roads. Wherever you are travelling, expect it to take longer than usual and factor in extra travel time.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 5AM TO 10AM

  • College Street between Park Street and Prince Albert Road      
  • Hunter Street between Macquarie Street and Elizabeth Street 
  • Macquarie Street between St James Road and Bent Street
  • Prince Albert Road between St James Road and College Street       
  • St James Road between Elizabeth Street and Prince Albert Road    
  • St Mary's Road between Prince Albert Road and Sir John Young Crescent (Northern Side)
  • St Mary's Road between Boomerang Place / Yurong Pkwy and College St (Southern Side) 

FROM 5AM TO 12PM MIDDAY

  • Hospital Road between Prince Albert Road and Sydney Hospital Pedestrian Crossing (Both Sides)      
  • Prince Albert Road between College Street and Hospital Road (Northern Side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
SYDNEY CBD

FROM 5AM TO 12PM MIDDAY

  • Art Gallery Road from Hospital Road
  • Mrs Macquarie's Road from Art Gallery Road
  • Hospital Road* between Prince Albert Road and Shakespeare Place
  • Prince Albert Road between St Mary's Road and Hospital Road 

FROM 6AM TO 10AM

  • Boomerang Place/ Yurong Parkway between William Street and St Mary's Road (Northbound)
  • College Street between Park Street and Prince Albert Road
  • Macquarie Street between St James Road and Hunter Street
  • Prince Albert Road between St James Road and St Mary's Road
  • St James Road between Elizabeth Street and Prince Albert Road              
  • St Mary's Road^ between Prince Albert Road and Cathedral Street


Notes:

* Access to Hospital Road will be via Shakespeare Place only, in both directions. Vehicle access is limited to vehicles requiring access to Sydney Hospital, emergency services, contracted tow trucks and accredited / authorised event vehicles.

NB: Hospital Road will be heavily used by pedestrians before/during/after the event, crossing in both directions between The Domain and the start/finish line area.

^Managed Local Access into St Mary's Road to Cathedral Street and the Domain car park. St Mary's Rd will be closed at Sir John Young Cres when the Domain car park is full.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Broncos at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 8pm and full time 9:45pm.

Large crowds are expected and traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta during the already busy Friday evening peak. Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close after the game to allow crowds to safely leave the precinct. Be patient leaving car parks as traffic will be heavy and follow the directions of traffic controllers and Police.

While closures are in place motorists are encouraged to avoid driving through Parramatta CBD and detour around the closures via Grose St, Brickfield St, Victoria Rd and Wilde Ave in both directions.

Motorists should follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police and allow extra time when exiting car parks. Fans travelling home by taxi or ride share choose a pick up location away from the stadium to avoid traffic delays.

NRL: Panthers v Bulldogs at BlueBet Stadium. Kick-off at 6pm, full time approx. 8pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as thousands of fans travel to the stadium in the busy Friday evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

NRL: Dragons v Rabbitohs at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Preliminary games at 12:40pm and 3pm. NRL kick-off at 5:30pm, full time around 7:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close ahead of match start including Jubilee Avenue, Park Street and English Street. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.otherAdvice:
Anirudh Hukum concert will be taking place at Qudos Bank Arena on Saturday 11 May from 7pm until 10:30pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park while attendees travel to and from the precinct.

Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are urged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby: Waratahs v Brumbies at Allianz Stadium.Kick-off at 7.35pm, full time around 9.10pm. Wallaroos will play Canada at 4:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads around Moore Park as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 3:30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd (car park open from 4:30pm). EP2 Kippax car park will not be open for this match.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 10pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Warriors at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off at 2pm, full time around 4pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to the game.

Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 12pm midday and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP2 and EP3 grass car parks and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd (car park open from 11am).

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 11am until 6pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: On Fridays from 6pm and weekends from 5pm buses and light rail services will not run to Circular Quay. Buses will be relocated to stops at Martin Place and light rail services will run to and from Town Hall only. On Saturday nights and Sunday of the long weekend trains will not drop off passengers at Circular Quay. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your Vivid Sydney experience.
properties.otherAdvice:
Vivid Sydney returns for its 14th year to light up the city for 23 consecutive nights from Friday 24 May to Saturday 15 June from 6pm to 11pm each night. Road closures and special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect each night. 

Key road closure timings:

Nightly:

  • 12pm midday - midnight: Cumberland St south of Essex St
  • 3pm - midnight: Circular Quay West at the Overseas Passenger Terminal.
  • Each weekend From 2pm Friday to 1am Monday, George St will close between Lower Fort St and Hickson Rd for the Rocks markets.

Monday to Thursdays

  • 5pm – midnight: George St north of Alfred St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Pottinger St, Lower Fort St from George St, Merriman St, Rodens Lane and Loftus St. In Ultimo, Mary Ann St and Omnibus Lane will close. 

Fridays

  • 5pm – midnight: George St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Pottinger St, Lower Fort St, Windmill St, Merriman St, Rodens Lane and Loftus St. In Ultimo, Mary Ann St and Omnibus Lane will close. 
  • 6pm – midnight: roads in Circular Quay north of Bridge St including sections of Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets, and in Ultimo, Darling Dr between Pier St and Ultimo Rd.
  • 7pm – midnight: westbound lanes Erskine St from Clarence St to Sussex St and southbound lanes Kent St from Margaret St to Erskine St.

Saturdays and Sunday (9 June) of the long weekend 

  • 5pm - 1am: sections of Grosvenor St, Bridge St,  George St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Pottinger St, Lower Fort St, Windmill St, Merriman St, Rodens Lane, sections of Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets north of Bridge St. Westbound lanes Erskine St from Clarence St to Sussex St and southbound lanes Kent St from Margaret St to Erskine St.
  • No access east/west across the city via Grosvenor/Bridge Streets.
  • 5.30pm - midnight: Darling Dr between Pier St and Ultimo Rd, and Thomas St from Quay St.
  • 7pm - 11pm: Wheat Rd from Harbour St at Darling Harbour

Saturday 8, Sunday 9 and Saturday 15 June only - 8pm - 10pm: In Milsons Point Olympic Drive/Broughton from Alfred St Sth to Fitzroy St.

Sundays and Monday 10 June (public holiday)    

  • 5pm – midnight: George St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Pottinger St, Lower Fort St, Windmill St, Merriman St, Rodens Lane and Loftus St. In Ultimo, Mary Ann St and Omnibus Lane will close. Roads in Circular Quay north of Bridge St including sections of Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets. Westbound lanes Erskine St from Clarence St to Sussex St and southbound lanes Kent St from Margaret St to Erskine St.
  • 5.30pm - midnight: in Ultimo, Darling Dr between Pier St and Ultimo Rd, and Thomas St from Quay St.

Managed access to some hotels and businesses around The Rocks and Circular Quay will be maintained by traffic controllers on-site throughout Vivid Sydney when safe to do so.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 3pm to midnight each night on various key roads around Circular Quay and The Rocks, with more widespread clearways in the Sydney CBD in effect on weekends.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: George Street, Hickson Road, Bridge St, Grosvenor Street
roads.suburb: Sydney CBD, Circular Quay, The Rocks, Walsh Bay, Barangaroo, Darling Harbour

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Warriors at McDonald Jones Stadium. Preliminary game from 11:30am. NRL kick-off from 2pm, finish around 4pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains, and event shuttle buses will run from Caringbah, Cronulla and Woolooware train stations before and after the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Dragons at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off from 4:05pm, full-time approx 6pm.

Road closures will be in place on Captain Cook Drive from approximately 10 minutes before kick-off and remain in place until crowds have cleared after full-time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium will be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match. Allow extra travel time on Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Ironman 70.3 Port Macquarie will take place on Sunday 5 May from 4am to 6pm. Speed restrictions, road closures and detours will be in place from around 4am through to 8pm. Blackmans Point Interchange will be closed. Port Macquarie access via Port Macquarie Interchange (Oxley Highway). Delays are expected throughout Port Macquarie on the day with increased volume of pedestrians. Follow the direction of signage and traffic control.

Further information about local road impact, including maps, are available on Live Traffic.
properties.diversions:
During the event hours of 4am to 6pm, northbound motorists wanting to access Telegraph Point will need to plan for additional travel time. To detour:

  • Travel 14km north of Blackmans Point Interchange, exit the M1 using Yarabee Road Exit
  • Turn right to Taree using the underpass
  • Right to Taree to access the M1 southbound, travel approximately 3km south
  • Use the Telegraph Point exit Haydons Wharf Road.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Carlton at the SCG. First bounce 7:40pm, finish at 10:20pm.

With more than 30,000 fans expected traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to the match during busy Friday evening peak. Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the area before and after the game as delays are expected. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde, Oxford St and Lang Rd.

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the SCG from 4:45pm and will reopen after the game. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave.
  • Access to EP2 car park will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd. Car parks open from 4.45pm.
  • Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas between 3pm and midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Oxford St, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men Semi Final: Central Coast Mariners v Sydney FC at Industree Group Stadium. Kick-off at 7:45pm finish around 9:35pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will close before the match between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

AFL: GWS Giants v Western Bulldogs at ENGIE Stadium, Sydney Olympic Park. First bounce 4.35pm, full time around 7.20pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park while fans travel to and from the game at ENGIE Stadium.

Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are urged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
Pregnancy Babies & Childrens Expo at Sydney Showground on Saturday 18 and Sunday 19 May. Expo runs from 10am to 4pm daily.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct as attendees travel to and from the event. Ticketholders to Saturday’s event can expect heavy traffic leaving the precinct late afternoon as an AFL match also takes place at neighbouring ENGIE Stadium. 

Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive should pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the events unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details.﻿
